title: SAFETY Tool App
description: Take the concept of the SAFETY Tool mnemonic created to up skill fitness professionals in risk management, and present it in a fun and engaging way. A mobile application was the medium of choice due to high mobile engagement in the fitness sector. The overarching objective was to first guide the user through the tool, in an engaging and entertaining format, and create an app that the user found so helpful, that they would keep it on their phone as a point of information reference.

title: Lalla Rookh
description: The key to this project was to allow users to access the food and drink menu and support the brand in a cool and interesting way.

title: Melbourne Girls Grammar School
description: The site structure is heavily content based and needs to encompass individual departments throughout the School. There is a lot of written content for each department, and to change the way their visitors can access the information is a critical task along with creating an easy journey for the different users of the site.

title: Victorian Equal Opportunity & Human Rights Commission
description: This is a seamless, parallax scrolling site that looks great in all major browsers, displaying helpful information and calls to action in an inspiring, savvy manner. All while showcasing the latest and greatest of web development trends.

title: Birkenhead Point
description: Some of the key features of the site that are worth noting include an easy-to navigate-store finder for the convenience of shoppers, and a store directory which allows customers to easily find their favourite stores through category types and a store map. This shows exactly where a particular store is located in the mall.

title: Zuzushii
description: The site was created in the open source CMS Django, using the mezzanine framework, a platform with a focus on speed, flexibility and ease of use for both developer and client alike.

title: Luke Mangan
description: The site was developed in Joomla CMS with Virtumart for shopping cart. The site is supporting mobile devices as well.

title: Helvetica
description: To implement the bold and unique interface design JavaScript was utilised to link the stylised look with a functioning content management system.
